Class.name: websys.WorkFlowItem
Class.Description: A item which may be sequenced in a workflow. An item may be either a component or a page.

Property.name: ConditionalExpression
Property.Description:
Conditional expression is evaluated at the start of each work flow item (prior to evaluating transition expression).
This expression may be used to skip a specific item subject to a run time condition.
Conditional expression may be any valid Cache script. To force the controlling program to skip a workflow item at run time the conditional expression should set the variable 'val'. For example. To skip a workflow item for male patient:
s val=$s(sex="M":0,1:1)
if val=0 the item will be skipped.
if val=1 the item will be included.
By default a workflow item will be included in the workflow.

Property.name: TransitionExpression
Property.Description:
Transition expression is evaluated at the start of each work flow step.
It is typically used to coerce interfaces between workflow items.
For example,
where the output from one workflow item is the PatientID, and the input to the next worflow item is ID, we can set the transition expression as:
d %request.Set("ID",%request.Get("PatientID"))
Since transition expression can be any valid Cache script we can also perform more sophisticated operations such as calling a clas method to get the current patient episode id.

Parameter.name: xmlidentifiedby
Parameter.Description: Used in conjunction with XMLId method to unqiuely identify a record. By default ..%Id() is used unless other properties are specified. A comma separated list may be provided and processed by overridding XMLId method
